body.name: JASON Natural Body Wash & Shower Gel, Invigorating Rosewater, 30 Oz
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 16 hrs 24 mins
features: One 30 oz. bottle of JASON Invigorating Rosewater Body Wash
Infused with nutrient-rich vitamin E and pro-vitamin B5
Features rosewater and grapefruit extract for soft, smooth and energized skin
Free of parabens, harsh sulfates, phthalates and petrolatum
body.description: Gently cleanse and nourish your skin with JASON Invigorating Rosewater Body Wash. Infused with nutrient-rich vitamin E and pro-vitamin B5, plus revitalizing rosewater and soothing calendula extract, our gentle body wash moisturizes and hydrates skin, leaving skin feeling soft, smooth and uplifted. Our formula is made with safe, gentler and effective ingredients and contains no parabens, harsh sulfates, phthalates or petrolatum. It is also not tested on animals.*

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #715 in Beauty & Personal Care (See Top 100 in Beauty & Personal Care) #21 in Bath & Shower Gels

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Our Story The JASON brand believes in the power of nature's ingredients to improve everyday wellness. We were pioneers of safer, wholesome personal care, and we continue to harness the earth's bounty of botanicals and essentials for blends that refresh and restore. Wellness is our second nature, and it has been since 1959. JASON Purifying Tea Tree Body Wash, 30 oz. Gently cleanse and nourish your skin with JASON Invigorating Rosewater Body Wash. Infused with nutrient-rich vitamin E and pro-vitamin B5, plus revitalizing rosewater and soothing calendula extract, our gentle body wash moisturizes and hydrates skin, leaving skin feeling soft, smooth and uplifted. Our formula is made with safe, gentler and effective ingredients and contains no parabens, harsh sulfates, phthalates or petrolatum. It is also not tested on animals. *Cruelty Free is certified by the CCIC on October 1st, 2008. *See ingredients list for no parabens and non-gmo verification

Born on Simple, Safe and Gentler Ingredients Disenchanted by big companies and big chemicals, this group harnessed their free-spirited California mindset, leading them back to simple, safe, and gentler ingredients. And thus, a new brand centered around the restorative power of nature’s botanicals was born. It only felt natural that they call it JĀSÖN - an honorable word meaning 'healer' in Greek. With each new generation, the JĀSÖN brand has remained committed to discovering even more ways to offer personal care solutions that are safe for families and friends.

JASON Energizing Citrus Body Wash JASON Soothing Aloe Vera Body Wash JASON Purifying Tea Tree Body Wash JASON Calming Lavender Body Wash More Better-For-You Options from JASON Infused with pro-vitamin B5, plus sparkling lemongrass extract and orange peel, our gentle body wash moisturizes and hydrates skin, leaving skin feeling soft, smooth and energized. Infused with nutrientrich vitamin E and pro-vitamin B5 that moisturizes and delivers lipid relief, leaving skin feeling calm and soft. Purifying tea tree oil and soothing aloe vera gently moisturizes and hydrates skin, leaving skin feeling soft, smooth and balanced. Soothing lavender and marigold extracts gently moisturizes and soothes skin, leaving skin feeling smooth, soft and comforted.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars New shipping package works great
reviews.reviewText: This rosewater body wash is wonderful. Silky feeling and aromatherapy in the shower. It is my 3rd time ordering. The first time the container pump broke in shipping. Replaced for free. The new packaging is fantastic - I'm pretty impressed how simple but effective the design to wrap and ship works. Good job!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Shower Time Shenanigans Unleashed!
reviews.reviewText: Move over, ordinary shower gels – the JASON Natural Moisturizing Herbs Body Wash is here to turn your daily scrub-a-dub into a comedy show for your skin!I was initially skeptical. Moisturizing herbs? Is my shower going to feel like a secret garden spa or just a rainforest with a lot of plant friends? Well, let me tell you, my shower is now officially the hottest comedy club in town, thanks to JASON.First off, the scent is like a delightful herb party in your shower. Forget singing in the rain; I'm doing stand-up with the Moisturizing Herbs ensemble. It's so refreshing; I half expect my loofah to join in with a knock-knock joke.Now, let's talk about the moisturizing magic – my skin feels softer than a kitten in a cashmere sweater. If I had a mic, I'd drop it in sheer shower satisfaction.The 30 oz bottle is like the comedian who never leaves the stage – it just keeps delivering laughs (and suds). It's like having a stand-up special every day, and my skin is the star of the show.Plus, the label promises "no parabens or harsh sulfates." I appreciate that. Who needs harsh sulfates when your shower is already full of drama? This body wash keeps it real – just like a good punchline.In conclusion, if you want your shower routine to be more fun than a barrel of monkeys (with herbs), JASON Natural Moisturizing Herbs Body Wash is your ticket to a clean comedy act. Five stars for the laughter, applause, and the freshest feeling ever!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best bath soap
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this for years now. It's the best for shower or bath - not slippery but plenty of lather, smells heavenly but not too strong. And one container lasts for a long, long time. And natural. Good stuff!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars wonderful product with lilac scent
reviews.reviewText: this is great body soap but the scent is strong old lilac scent not rose. If you like that kinda parfumy thing you will love it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars True scent of Lavender
reviews.reviewText: This Soap by Jason is being used by my entire family. We usually buy it locally at a specialty supermarket but unfortunately the price has crept up so high that I had to look elsewhere. So I looked where I find most everything… on Amazon. The price is is great - the same that it used to be at our market about 5 years ago.The scent smells like true Lavender, but not overwhelming and it is nicely moisturizing. Highly recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Soft fragrance and moisturizing
reviews.reviewText: A while back I purchased the Rosewater scent body wash from Jason and loved it. So this time I decided to try the Coconut body wash, I’m throwing it out! It has a chemical weird scent that I am frightened to use. It smells nothing like coconut but has a strange odor. I don’t know if it’s a knock off but if I was the President of that company I would look into the Coconut body wash. My intuition is telling me get rid of it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Citrus is more watery than other scents of this product
reviews.reviewText: Citrus is more watery than other scents of this product. Smells great. Likely works great like other scents, but arrived almost empty with contents leaked all over both boxes it was in. Not returnable, but Amazon refunded.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2012
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Smells like chemicals, not Lavender. Sensitive people beware!
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to like this body wash. I really did. The price was right, and I thought the product would be natural enough for me. Apparently not.Immediately upon opening the box, I could smell the perfume. The bottles weren't leaking at all, either. So, very strong scent. Now, let's be clear: I AM mildly sensitive to chemicals and perfumes, but I can't recall ever sneezing uncontrollably to anything NATURAL. I use essential oils all the time (which have strong scents, though natural), as well as heavily scented natural products. Never a problem there. This made me sneeze like crazy when I used it. That's not a desirable effect in a shower, with hard surfaces to knock one's head on when you're flailing like, well, a person who is sneezing like crazy. It's especially not good for someone who recently had hip surgery (no, people, I'm actually only 27) because sneezing can make you nearly fall over in a slippery shower, especially when you're already unsteady. When I first got this (before surgery) it was still making me sneeze a week later. I thought *Hmm, that might fade. I might get acclimated to it. I'd better give it a good go, since I bought so much of it!* I bought this in November. It is now April. I have NOT acclimated to it. Still sneezing, and it's from this product. I know because I've made brief switches to other products (Burt's Bees, African Black bar soaps, castile soap) and haven't sneezed. Then I use this again. I shower, sneeze my brains out, hope I don't crack my head or fall, almost do, and kick myself for buying this. I'm not exaggerating; the sneezing fits are really quite extraordinary. I leave the door unlocked so my husband can rescue me in the event of a sneezing catastrophe. But, well... at least you know it lasts a long time!? I wish it didn't. Why am I still using it? "Waste not, want not", with a caveat: "Hope you don't die in the shower."There is definitely a chemical smell to this. Lavender? HA! One of my favorite essential oils to use is Lavender. This is NOT LAVENDER! It smells (to me) like a chemical re-creation of lavender. A very poor one.It does have its merits, however. What I can say for the wash is this: A couple of pumps does the job rather well, though I'm petite, so you may need a few more. It lathers well for a not-so-conventional, wants-to-be-"natural" body wash. It makes you feel clean without drying, yet doesn't make you feel over-moisturized or coated in something like super-moisturizing washes do. It also hasn't caused any skin irritation, which is a miracle for me, considering my reaction to the scent, and sensitive skin. The product is a good value, if your body doesn't give you violent reactions to it. So, three stars. I'm trying to be fair.Given the cleansing performance of this product, some (curious or self-destructive) part of me is tempted to try the tea tree. I love tea tree almost as much as lavender. But since this smells like chemical NOT-lavender, I'm afraid of what the tea tree would smell like/do. Perhaps it will make my eyeballs bleed and fall out? Okay, I'm kidding about my eyeballs. But I wouldn't buy this product again. If there is an unscented version, I might try a sample to see if it makes me react. Otherwise, when I'm done with this, I shall steer clear of the body wash of doom.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 25, 2023
Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have used Jason products for years and, despite initial expense, they are well worth the investment. A bottle of shower soap lasts me at least 6 months ! Lovely choice of fragrances and gentle lather.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: A very pleasant wash! But it doesn't smell like coconut.
reviews.reviewText: I would give it five star if it smelled like coconut 🥥

Sehr schönes Duschzeug. Hat einen cremigen Schaum und einen angenehm natürlichen Duft. Ich liebe die Bodywashs von Jason. Bislang hatte ich immer nur Lavendel aber nachdem es das eine zeitlang nicht mehr gab, bin ich zu Rose gewechselt und wurde nicht enttäuscht. Würde es wieder kaufen und hoffe, es bleibt bei Amazon im Programm.
